alert.note: Alert for Cascade (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:20PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cascade County through 445 PM MDT... At 418 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles east of Fort Shaw, or 12 miles west of Great Falls, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park and Ulm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A quick 1/2 inch to 1 and 1/2 inches of rain may occur with cell.
